messages.title: Why I am backing Emma Dent Coad
messages.content: Over her years as councillor, Emma has been a passionate advocate for Kensington's citizens, showing special concern for those who have failed to find that the government listens to or understands them. In addition, Emma's background in architecture and design offers a valuable perspective on the housing crisis.

messages.title: Tackling crime in the local community
messages.content: Over the past few years we've witnessed a rise in crime and anti-social behaviour, including drink and drug-related incidents. Let's make our streets safer by re-investing in community policing, bring back bobbies on our neighbourhoods and reversing the rise in crime.

messages.title: Providing high quality homes for local residents
messages.content: As a local councillor I have exposed negligence in standards of social housing, especially in new developments, including at Warwick Road, Earl's Court and Wornington Green. We must review existing plans, including by-outs, to stop the rise in empty homes caused by buy-to-leave investors.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Will work to protect Kensington from unwanted development and support truly affordable housing.
Will fight for more resources to improve air quality and preserve our precious green spaces.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Bringing local business, jobs and training
keyPolicies.policyDescription: Will stand up for local and independent businesses and provide good quality, paid apprenticeship schemes.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Getting the best deal out of Brexit
keyPolicies.policyDescription: The EU is vital for our local economy, we must fight against harmful hard Brexit against Theresa May's hard Brexit.

issues.brexitEurope: Nearly 70% of Kensington residents voted to Remain in the EU. While our Tory MP supports a hard Brexit which will devastate our vibrant local economy and our rights and protections, I will fight to stay in the EU. Fight to stay in the EU, protect our residents' rights and our vital trade deals, and sustain and enhance existing relationships.
issues.environment: Will fight for more resources to improve air quality and preserve our precious green spaces.

housing.content: As a local councillor I have exposed negligence in standards of social housing, especially in new developments, including at Warwick Road, Earl's Court and Wornington Green. We must review existing plans, including by-outs, to stop the rise in empty homes caused by buy-to-leave investors.

leaflet.personalStatement: I was born and bred in the Borough and have lived in Ladbroke Grove for 30 years. I am a writer, researcher and journalist in the field of design, architecture and planning.

politicalExperience.achievements: Has fought to protect the integrity and heritage of our communities against all comers' the Council.

politicalExperience.role: GLA oversight committee work with the Mayor and Parliament
politicalExperience.achievements: Meeting to demand better health services and a fair deal for our social and private sector tenants.

contactInformation.address: Kensington Labour, c/o 95 St. Marks Road, London W10 6JY

images.caption: Campaigning for the fare freeze which our Mayor delivered
